newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares drifting, dealers search for bait.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares drifting, dealers search for bait.

text.p: Singapore shares were adrift on a sea of indifference on Tuesday morning, with dealers searching for fresh bait to tempt reluctant investors.
"There's a lack of fresh factors in the market. Even the U.S. doesn't give us too much to hook on to these days," said one dealer with a local firm.
"Investors are still sidelined because of the currencies and they want to be sure that the economy is really picking up here," another dealer said.
At the 0430 GMT lunch break, the Straits Times Industrials Index had crept up 6.19 to 1,981.20.
Small cap stocks again dominated activity, with 15 of the morning's top 20 volume leaders listed at less than Singapore $3.00.
Total market volume was a pedestrian 78 million shares which produced 116 losers to 166 gainers.
Monday's main winners and losers switched roles, with Venture Manufacturing sinking S$0.50 to S$6.40 while Cycle & Carriage rose S$0.40 to S$13.00.
